00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Functions for writing and reading ATmega memory.
00031  *
00032  * @file atmega.c

00040 #include <stdio.h>
00041 #include <stdlib.h>
00042 #include <string.h>
00043 #include "common.h"
00044 #include "atmega.h"
00045 #include "ftSpi.h"
00046 #include "atmegaDevices.h"
00047 #include "crc16.h"
00048 
00049 
00050 /** Find number of chips specified in atmegaChips.h **/
00051 #define NUM_SUPPORTED_CHIPS  ((sizeof(atmega_infoTable)/sizeof(uint32_t))/5)
00052 
00053 /* Used as index when accessing atmega_infoTable */
00054 #define IND_SIGBYTE                 0
00055 #define IND_FLASHSIZE               1
00056 #define IND_FLASHPAGESIZE           2
00057 #define IND_EEPROMSIZE              3
00058 #define IND_EEPROMPAGESIZE          4
00059 
00060 /* SPI instructions. */
00061 #define PROG_EN                     0xAC53
00062 #define CHIP_ERASE                  0xAC80
00063 #define POLL_RDY                    0xF000
00064 #define READ_PROG_MEM_LOW           0x2000
00065 #define READ_PROG_MEM_HIGH          0x2800
00066 #define LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_LOW      0x4000
00067 #define LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_HIGH     0x4800
00068 #define WRITE_PROG_MEM_PAGE         0x4C00
00069 #define READ_EEPROM_MEM             0xA000
00070 #define WRITE_EEPROM_MEM            0xC000
00071 #define READ_LOCK_BITS              0x5800
00072 #define WRITE_LOCK_BITS             0xACE0
00073 #define READ_SIG_BYTE               0x3000
00074 #define WRITE_FUSE_BITS             0xACA0
00075 #define WRITE_FUSE_HIGH_BITS        0xACA8
00076 #define WRITE_FUSE_EXT_BITS         0xACA4
00077 #define READ_FUSE_BITS              0x5000
00078 #define READ_FUSE_EXT_BITS          0x5008
00079 #define READ_FUSE_HIGH_BITS         0x5808
00080 #define READ_CALIB_BYTE             0x3800
00081 
00082 /* Addresses in Memory */
00083 #define REPROG_CODE_SIZE            0xF800
00084 #define REPROG_CODE_OFFSET          info.memorySize / 2
00085 #define REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET        REPROG_CODE_SIZE
00086 #define REPROG_HEADER_SIZE          0x08
00087 #define REPROG_BOOTLOADER_OFFSET    0x1F800UL
00088 
00089 /* Use these to index three fuse bytes */
00090 #define FUSE_LOW                    2
00091 #define FUSE_HIGH                   1
00092 #define FUSE_EXT                    0
00093 
00094 /* Delay values in ms (about 200% of values in the datasheet)*/
00095 #define DELAY_INIT                  40
00096 #define DELAY_FLASH                 10
00097 #define DELAY_EEPROM                20
00098 #define DELAY_ERASE                 20
00099 
00100 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to the chip select. **/
00101 #define PIN_NCS_25MM                0x08
00102 
00103 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to the SPI clock. **/
00104 #define PIN_SCK_25MM                0x04
00105 
00106 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to UART0 RX. **/
00107 #define PIN_RX_25MM                 0x01
00108 
00109 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to UART0 TX. **/
00110 #define PIN_TX_25MM                 0x02
00111 
00112 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to MISO. **/
00113 #define PIN_MISO_25MM               0x40
00114 
00115 /** Bit mask for pin that is connected to MOSI. **/
00116 #define PIN_MOSI_25MM               0x10
00117 
00118 
00119 /** Page size of memory. This is set by @c atmega_init() **/
00120 static uint32_t pageSize;
00121 
00122 /**
00123  * Structure storing details of this programmer.
00124  *
00125  * Note about clock edge: Atmel documentation says that when data is written to
00126  * the ATmega, it is clocked on the rising edge. When data is being read from
00127  * the ATmega, it is clocked on the falling edge. However it seems to work ok,
00128  * clocking on the rising edge in both directions.
00129  **/
00130 static spiDeviceInfo_t info = {
00131     DESC_25MM_PROG,                 /* Description. */
00132     PIN_NCS_25MM,                   /* nCS pin. */
00133     PIN_SCK_25MM,                   /* SCK pin. */
00134     0x00,                           /* MISO pin (set later). */
00135     0x00,                           /* MOSI pin (set later). */
00136     FTSPI_MAX_BAUDRATE,             /* Baud rate. */
00137     0,                              /* Memory Size (set later). */
00138     0,                              /* Code Size (set later). */
00139     {{0, 0}, {0, 0}, {0, 0}, {0, 0}},   /* Write addresses (set later). */
00140     atmega_write,
00141     atmega_read,
00142     atmega_erase,
00143     atmega_addHeader,
00144 };
00145 
00146 static memType_t memType;
00147 static uint32_t sigBytes = 0;
00148 
00149 /* Prototypes for local functions. */
00150 static void writeFlashPage(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t start, uint32_t end);
00151 static void readFlash(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00152 static void writeEeprom(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00153 static void writeFlash(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00154 static void readEeprom(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00155 static void writeFuses(const uint8_t data[3]);
00156 static void readFuses(uint8_t data[3]);
00157 static bool initAtmega(void);
00158 static void eraseFlash(void);
00159 static void eraseEeprom(void);
00160 static uint32_t readSigBytes(void);
00161 static void spiInstruction(uint8_t bytes[4]);
00162 
00163 
00164 /******************************************************************************\
00165  * Functions that be used externally. Documentation in atmega.h.
00166  */
00167 
00168 
00169 spiDeviceInfo_t* atmega_init(memType_t memory, bool isSlowClock)
00170 {
00171     /* Remember what type of memory is being programmed */
00172     memType = memory;
00173 
00174     uint32_t i;
00175 
00176     /* ATmega128 uses UART pins for SPI programming. Try this first */
00177     info.miso = PIN_TX_25MM;
00178     info.mosi = PIN_RX_25MM;
00179 
00180     if (isSlowClock) {
00181         info.baudRate = SLOW_BAUDRATE;
00182     }
00183 
00184     /* Initialise SPI comms with these pins */
00185     ftSpi_init(&info);
00186 
00187     if (!initAtmega()) {
00188         /* If first selection of pins didn't work, try with SPI pins: */
00189         info.miso = PIN_MISO_25MM;
00190         info.mosi = PIN_MOSI_25MM;
00191 
00192         ftSpi_close();
00193         ftSpi_init(&info);
00194         if (!initAtmega()) {
00195             fprintf(stderr,
00196                     "ERROR: Could not communicate with ATmega. Check connections and power\n");
00197             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00198         }
00199     }
00200 
00201     sigBytes = readSigBytes();
00202 
00203     printf(" ATmega signature bytes: %.6X", sigBytes);
00204 
00205     /* Set memory and page sizes */
00206     for (i = 0; i < NUM_SUPPORTED_CHIPS; ++i) {
00207         if (sigBytes == atmega_infoTable[i][IND_SIGBYTE]) {
00208             printf(" = %s.\n", atmega_strings[i]);
00209             if (memType == MEM_ATMEGA_FLASH) {
00210                 info.memorySize = atmega_infoTable[i][IND_FLASHSIZE];
00211                 info.codeSize = atmega_infoTable[i][IND_FLASHSIZE];
00212                 pageSize = atmega_infoTable[i][IND_FLASHPAGESIZE];
00213             }
00214             else if (memType == MEM_ATMEGA_EEPROM) {
00215                 info.memorySize = atmega_infoTable[i][IND_EEPROMSIZE];
00216                 info.codeSize = atmega_infoTable[i][IND_EEPROMSIZE];
00217                 pageSize = atmega_infoTable[i][IND_EEPROMPAGESIZE];
00218             }
00219             else if (memType == MEM_ATMEGA_FUSES) {
00220                 info.memorySize = 3;
00221                 info.codeSize = 3;
00222                 pageSize = 3;
00223             }
00224             else {
00225                 fprintf(stderr, "\nERROR: Invalid memType: %X.\n", memType);
00226                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00227             }
00228             break;
00229         }
00230     }
00231 
00232     if (info.memorySize == 0) {
00233         fprintf(stderr,
00234                 "\nERROR: Unrecognised Atmel signature bytes. Supported chips are:\n");
00235         for (i = 0; i < NUM_SUPPORTED_CHIPS; i++) {
00236             fprintf(stderr, "       %s, 0x%X\n",
00237                     atmega_strings[i], atmega_infoTable[i][IND_SIGBYTE]);
00238         }
00239         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00240     }
00241 
00242     return &info;
00243 }
00244 
00245 
00246 void atmega_write(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00247 {
00248     static bool isCalled = false;
00249 
00250     /* Check if address is valid */
00251     if (address + size > info.memorySize) {
00252         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: data size too big (%u) at %s.\n", size,
00253                 stripPath(LOC));
00254         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00255     }
00256 
00257     switch(memType) {
00258     case MEM_ATMEGA_FLASH:  if (isCalled == false) {
00259                                 eraseFlash();       /* Only erase once */
00260                                 isCalled = true;
00261                             }
00262                             writeFlash(data, address, size);
00263                             break;
00264 
00265     case MEM_ATMEGA_EEPROM: writeEeprom(data, address, size);
00266                             break;
00267 
00268     case MEM_ATMEGA_FUSES:  writeFuses(data);
00269                             break;
00270 
00271     default:                fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Invalid memType: %X\n",
00272                                     memType);
00273                             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00274     }
00275 }
00276 
00277 
00278 void atmega_read(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00279 {
00280     /* Check if address is valid */
00281     if (address + size > info.memorySize) {
00282         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: data size too big (%u) at %s.\n", size,
00283                 stripPath(LOC));
00284         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00285     }
00286 
00287     switch(memType) {
00288     case MEM_ATMEGA_FLASH:  readFlash(data, address, size);
00289                             break;
00290 
00291     case MEM_ATMEGA_EEPROM: readEeprom(data, address, size);
00292                             break;
00293 
00294     case MEM_ATMEGA_FUSES:  readFuses(data);
00295                             break;
00296 
00297     default:                fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Invalid memType: %X\n",
00298                             memType);
00299                             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00300     }
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00304 void atmega_erase(void)
00305 {
00306     switch(memType) {
00307     case MEM_ATMEGA_FLASH:
00308         eraseFlash();
00309         break;
00310 
00311     case MEM_ATMEGA_EEPROM:
00312         eraseEeprom();
00313         break;
00314 
00315     case MEM_ATMEGA_FUSES:
00316         fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: Fuses cannot be erased.");
00317         break;
00318 
00319     default:
00320         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Invalid memType: %X\n", memType);
00321         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00322     }
00323 }
00324 
00325 
00326 void atmega_addHeader(uint8_t* data, uint32_t rawCodeSize,
00327                       bool isSupportReprog)
00328 {
00329     uint32_t i;
00330     uint32_t codeEnd = 0;
00331 
00332     /* Do nothing if reprogramming support is not needed */
00333     if (!isSupportReprog) {
00334         info.writeAdds[0][0] = 0;
00335         info.writeAdds[0][1] = rawCodeSize;
00336         return;
00337     }
00338 
00339     /* Set actual size available for code */
00340     info.codeSize = REPROG_CODE_SIZE;
00341 
00342     /* Find actual location of code end and bootloader end */
00343     for (i = info.codeSize; i > 0; i--) {
00344         if (data[i] == 0x00 || data[i] == 0xFF) codeEnd = i;
00345         else break;
00346     }
00347 
00348     /* Location of last byte with data */
00349     codeEnd--;
00350 
00351     /* Set up locations that need to be written to */
00352     info.writeAdds[0][0] = 0;
00353     info.writeAdds[0][1] = codeEnd;
00354     info.writeAdds[1][0] = REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET;
00355     info.writeAdds[1][1] = REPROG_HEADER_SIZE;
00356     info.writeAdds[2][0] = info.memorySize / 2;
00357     info.writeAdds[2][1] = codeEnd;
00358     info.writeAdds[3][0] = REPROG_BOOTLOADER_OFFSET;
00359     info.writeAdds[3][1] = rawCodeSize - REPROG_BOOTLOADER_OFFSET;
00360 
00361     /* Copy code data to upper section */
00362     for (i = 0; i < codeEnd; i++) {
00363         data[i + (info.memorySize / 2)] = data[i];
00364     }
00365 
00366     /* Calculate CRC-16 value for program code */
00367     crc16_init();
00368     for (i = 0; i < codeEnd; i++) {
00369         crc16_update(data[i]);
00370     }
00371 
00372     /* Write application header */
00373     data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET] = data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 4] =
00374                                                             getLowByte(codeEnd);
00375 
00376     data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 1] = data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 5] =
00377                                                            getHighByte(codeEnd);
00378 
00379     data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 2] = data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 6] =
00380                                                        getLowByte(crc16_read());
00381 
00382     data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 3] = data[REPROG_HEADER_OFFSET + 7] =
00383                                                       getHighByte(crc16_read());
00384 
00385 }
00386 
00387 
00388 void atmega_reset(void)
00389 {
00390     ftSpi_enableChipSelect();
00391     sleep_ms(20);
00392     ftSpi_disableChipSelect();
00393 }
00394 
00395 
00396 void atmega_parseFuseValues(const char* fuseString, uint8_t data[3])
00397 {
00398     bool isError = false;
00399     int values[3];   /* sscanf wants to write to integers */
00400 
00401     /* Check string length */
00402     if (strlen(fuseString) != 6) {
00403         isError = true;
00404     }
00405     else {
00406         /* Convert and test if conversion was successful */
00407         if (3 != sscanf(fuseString, "%2X%2X%2X",
00408                     &values[FUSE_EXT], &values[FUSE_HIGH], &values[FUSE_LOW])) {
00409             isError = true;
00410         }
00411     }
00412     if (isError) {
00413         fprintf(stderr,
00414                 "ERROR: Fuse must be a 6 hexadecimal digits, e.g. FF91E4.\n\n");
00415         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00416     }
00417 
00418     /* Prevent user from disabling serial interface */
00419     if ((values[1] & 0x20) != 0) {
00420         printf("WARNING: Cannot disable SPI programming interface."
00421                "         Use a JTAG programmer if you really want to do this.\n");
00422         values[1] |= 0x20;
00423     }
00424 
00425     data[FUSE_EXT] = values[FUSE_EXT];
00426     data[FUSE_HIGH] = values[FUSE_HIGH];
00427     data[FUSE_LOW] = values[FUSE_LOW];
00428 }
00429 
00430 
00431 void atmega_printFuseInfo(uint8_t fuses[3])
00432 {
00433     printf(" Fuses: %.2X%.2X%.2X\n\n", fuses[0], fuses[1], fuses[2]);
00434 
00435     if (sigBytes == ATMEGA_ATMEGA128_SIG) {
00436         printf("  Brown-out detection level at VCC = ");
00437         printf((fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x80) ? "2.7V\n" : "4.0V \n");
00438 
00439         printf("  Brown out detection ");
00440         printf((fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x40) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00441 
00442         switch (fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x3F) {
00443             case 0x00: printf("  Ext. clock. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00444             case 0x10: printf("  Ext. clock. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00445             case 0x20: printf("  Ext. clock. Startup: 6CK + 64ms"); break;
00446             case 0x01: printf("  Int. RC osc. 1MHz. Startup: 6K + 0ms"); break;
00447             case 0x11: printf("  Int. RC osc. 1MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00448             case 0x21: printf("  Int. RC osc. 1MHz. Startup: 6CK + 64ms"); break;
00449             case 0x02: printf("  Int. RC osc. 2MHz. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00450             case 0x12: printf("  Int. RC osc. 2MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00451             case 0x22: printf("  Int. RC osc. 2MHz. Startup: 6CK + 64ms"); break;
00452             case 0x03: printf("  Int. RC osc. 4MHz. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00453             case 0x13: printf("  Int. RC osc. 4MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00454             case 0x23: printf("  Int. RC osc. 4MHz. Startup: 6CK + 64ms"); break;
00455             case 0x04: printf("  Int. RC osc. 8MHz. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00456             case 0x14: printf("  Int. RC osc. 8MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00457             case 0x24: printf("  Int. RC osc. 8MHz. Startup: 6CK + 64ms"); break;
00458             case 0x05: printf("  Ext. RC osc. < 0.9MHz. Startup: 18CK + 0ms"); break;
00459             case 0x15: printf("  Ext. RC osc. < 0.9MHz. Startup: 18CK + 4ms"); break;
00460             case 0x25: printf("  Ext. RC osc. < 0.9MHz. Startup: 18CK + 64ms"); break;
00461             case 0x35: printf("  Ext. RC osc. < 0.9MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00462             case 0x06: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 0ms"); break;
00463             case 0x16: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 4ms"); break;
00464             case 0x26: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 64ms"); break;
00465             case 0x36: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00466             case 0x07: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 0ms"); break;
00467             case 0x17: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 4ms"); break;
00468             case 0x27: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 64ms"); break;
00469             case 0x37: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00470             case 0x08: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 8.0 - 12.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 0ms"); break;
00471             case 0x18: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 8.0 - 12.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 4ms"); break;
00472             case 0x28: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 8.0 - 12.0MHz. Startup: 18CK + 64ms"); break;
00473             case 0x38: printf("  Ext. RC osc. 8.0 - 12.0MHz. Startup: 6CK + 4ms;"); break;
00474             case 0x09: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. startup. 1000CK + 4ms"); break;
00475             case 0x19: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. startup. 1000CK + 64ms"); break;
00476             case 0x29: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. startup. 32000CK + 64ms"); break;
00477             case 0x0A: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 258CK + 4ms"); break;
00478             case 0x1A: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 258CK + 64ms"); break;
00479             case 0x2A: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00480             case 0x3A: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 1000CK + 4ms"); break;
00481             case 0x0B: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 1000CK + 64ms"); break;
00482             case 0x1B: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00483             case 0x2B: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 16000CK + 4ms"); break;
00484             case 0x3B: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator low freq. Startup: 16000CK + 64ms"); break;
00485             case 0x0C: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 258CK + 4ms"); break;
00486             case 0x1C: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 258CK + 64ms"); break;
00487             case 0x2C: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00488             case 0x3C: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 1000CK + 4ms"); break;
00489             case 0x0D: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 1000CK + 64ms"); break;
00490             case 0x1D: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00491             case 0x2D: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 16000CK + 4ms"); break;
00492             case 0x3D: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator medium freq. Startup: 16000CK + 64ms"); break;
00493             case 0x0E: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 258CK + 4ms"); break;
00494             case 0x1E: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 258CK + 64ms"); break;
00495             case 0x2E: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00496             case 0x3E: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 1000CK + 4ms"); break;
00497             case 0x0F: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 1000CK + 64ms"); break;
00498             case 0x1F: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00499             case 0x2F: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 16000CK + 4ms"); break;
00500             case 0x3F: printf("  Ext. crystal/resonator high freq. Startup: 16000CK + 64ms"); break;
00501             default: printf("  Clock Source = 0x%.6X", fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x3F);
00502         }
00503         printf("\n");
00504 
00505         printf("  On-Chip Debug ");
00506         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x80) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00507 
00508         printf("  JTAG " );
00509         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x40) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00510 
00511         printf("  Serial program downloading (SPI) ");
00512         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x20) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00513 
00514         printf("  Preserve EEPROM memory through the Chip Erase cycle: ");
00515         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x08) ? "no\n" : "yes\n");
00516 
00517         printf("  Boot Flash section size: ");
00518         switch (fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x06) {
00519             case 0x00: printf("8192"); break;
00520             case 0x02: printf("4096"); break;
00521             case 0x04: printf("2048"); break;
00522             case 0x06: printf("1024");  break;
00523         }
00524 
00525         printf("bytes. Boot start address: ");
00526         switch (fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x06) {
00527             case 0x00: printf("0xF000\n"); break;
00528             case 0x02: printf("0xF800\n"); break;
00529             case 0x04: printf("0xFC00\n"); break;
00530             case 0x06: printf("0xFE00\n");  break;
00531         }
00532 
00533         printf("  Boot reset vector ");
00534         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x01) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00535 
00536         printf("  CKOPT = ");
00537         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x08) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00538 
00539         printf("  ATmega103 compatibility mode ");
00540         printf((fuses[FUSE_EXT] & 0x02) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00541 
00542         printf("  Watchdog timer always on = ");
00543         printf((fuses[FUSE_EXT] & 0x01) ? "no\n" : "yes\n");
00544     }
00545     else if (sigBytes == ATMEGA_ATMEGA1281_SIG) {
00546         printf("  Divide clock by 8 internally: ");
00547         printf((fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x80) ? "no\n" : "yes\n");
00548 
00549         printf("  Clock output on PORTE7: ");
00550         printf((fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x40) ? "no\n" : "yes\n");
00551 
00552         switch (fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x3F) {
00553             case 0x00: printf("  Ext. clock. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00554             case 0x10: printf("  Ext. clock. Startup: 6CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00555             case 0x20: printf("  Ext. clock. Startup: 6CK + 65ms"); break;
00556             case 0x02: printf("  Int. RC osc. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00557             case 0x12: printf("  Int. RC osc. Startup: 6CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00558             case 0x22: printf("  Int. RC osc. Startup: 6CK + 65ms"); break;
00559             case 0x03: printf("  Int. 128kHz RC osc. Startup: 6CK + 0ms"); break;
00560             case 0x13: printf("  Int. 128kHz RC osc. Startup: 6CK + 4ms"); break;
00561             case 0x23: printf("  Int. 128kHz RC osc. Startup: 6CK + 64ms"); break;
00562             case 0x04: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00563             case 0x14: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. Startup: 1000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00564             case 0x24: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. Startup: 1000CK + 65ms"); break;
00565             case 0x05: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. Startup: 32000CK + 0ms"); break;
00566             case 0x15: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. Startup: 32000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00567             case 0x25: printf("  Ext. low-freq. crystal. Startup: 32000CK + 65ms"); break;
00568             case 0x06: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 258CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00569             case 0x16: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 258CK + 65ms"); break;
00570             case 0x26: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00571             case 0x36: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 1000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00572             case 0x07: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 1000CK + 65ms"); break;
00573             case 0x17: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00574             case 0x27: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 16000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00575             case 0x37: printf("  Full swing osc. Startup: 16000CK + 65ms"); break;
00576             case 0x08: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 258CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00577             case 0x18: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 258CK + 65ms"); break;
00578             case 0x28: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00579             case 0x38: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00580             case 0x09: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 65ms"); break;
00581             case 0x19: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00582             case 0x29: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00583             case 0x39: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.4 - 0.9MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 65ms"); break;
00584             case 0x0A: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 258CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00585             case 0x1A: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 258CK + 65ms"); break;
00586             case 0x2A: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00587             case 0x3A: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00588             case 0x0B: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 65ms"); break;
00589             case 0x1B: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00590             case 0x2B: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00591             case 0x3B: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 0.9 - 3.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 65ms"); break;
00592             case 0x0C: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 258CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00593             case 0x1C: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 258CK + 65ms"); break;
00594             case 0x2C: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00595             case 0x3C: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00596             case 0x0D: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 65ms"); break;
00597             case 0x1D: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00598             case 0x2D: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00599             case 0x3D: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. 3.0 - 8.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 65ms"); break;
00600             case 0x0E: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 258CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00601             case 0x1E: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 258CK + 65ms"); break;
00602             case 0x2E: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 0ms"); break;
00603             case 0x3E: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00604             case 0x0F: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 1000CK + 65ms"); break;
00605             case 0x1F: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 0ms"); break;
00606             case 0x2F: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 4.1ms"); break;
00607             case 0x3F: printf("  Ext. crystal osc. > 8.0MHz. Startup: 16000CK + 65ms"); break;
00608             default: printf("  Clock Source = 0x%.6X", fuses[FUSE_LOW] & 0x3F);
00609         }
00610         printf("\n");
00611 
00612         printf("  On-Chip Debug ");
00613         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x80) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00614 
00615         printf("  JTAG " );
00616         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x40) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00617 
00618         printf("  Serial program downloading (SPI) ");
00619         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x20) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00620 
00621         printf("  Watchdog timer always on = ");
00622         printf((fuses[FUSE_EXT] & 0x10) ? "no\n" : "yes\n");
00623 
00624         printf("  Preserve EEPROM memory through the Chip Erase cycle: ");
00625         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x08) ? "no\n" : "yes\n");
00626 
00627         printf("  Boot Flash section size: ");
00628         switch (fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x06) {
00629             case 0x00: printf("8192"); break;
00630             case 0x02: printf("4096"); break;
00631             case 0x04: printf("2048"); break;
00632             case 0x06: printf("1024");  break;
00633         }
00634 
00635         printf("bytes. Boot start address: ");
00636         switch (fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x06) {
00637             case 0x00: printf("0xF000\n"); break;
00638             case 0x02: printf("0xF800\n"); break;
00639             case 0x04: printf("0xFC00\n"); break;
00640             case 0x06: printf("0xFE00\n");  break;
00641         }
00642 
00643         printf("  Boot reset vector ");
00644         printf((fuses[FUSE_HIGH] & 0x01) ? "disabled\n" : "enabled\n");
00645 
00646         switch (fuses[FUSE_EXT] & 0x07) {
00647             case 0x07: printf("  Brown-out detection disabled\n"); break;
00648             case 0x06: printf("  Brown-out detection level at VCC = 1.8V\n"); break;
00649             case 0x05: printf("  Brown-out detection level at VCC = 2.7V\n"); break;
00650             case 0x04: printf("  Brown-out detection level at VCC = 4.3V\n");  break;
00651         }
00652     }
00653 }
00654 
00655 
00656 /******************************************************************************\
00657  * Functions that can only be used within this file
00658  */
00659 
00660 
00661 /**
00662  * Initialises the atmega into programming mode.
00663  *
00664  * @return @c true if successful, @c false if not.
00665  **/
00666 static bool initAtmega(void)
00667 {
00668     uint8_t command[4];
00669     uint8_t readBytes[4];
00670     
00671     ftSpi_enableChipSelect();
00672     sleep_ms(DELAY_INIT);
00673     ftSpi_disableChipSelect();
00674 
00675     /* Wait at least 2 clock cycles */
00676     sleep_ms(DELAY_INIT);
00677     ftSpi_enableChipSelect();
00678 
00679     /* Wait at least 20ms */
00680     sleep_ms(DELAY_INIT);
00681     
00682     command[0] = getHighByte(PROG_EN);
00683     command[1] = getLowByte(PROG_EN);
00684     command[2] = 0;
00685     command[3] = 0;
00686 
00687     ftSpi_readWrite(readBytes, command, 4, false);
00688 
00689     if (readBytes[2] == getLowByte(PROG_EN)) {
00690         return true;
00691     }
00692     else {
00693         return false;
00694     }
00695 }
00696 
00697 
00698 /** Erases flash memory. **/
00699 static void eraseFlash(void)
00700 {
00701     uint8_t command[4];
00702 
00703     /* Erase current contents of flash */
00704     command[0] = getHighByte(CHIP_ERASE);
00705     command[1] = getLowByte(CHIP_ERASE);
00706     spiInstruction(command);
00707 
00708     sleep_ms(DELAY_ERASE);
00709 }
00710 
00711 
00712 /**
00713  * Reads and returns signature bytes of ATmega.
00714  *
00715  * @return signature bytes as 32bit integer.
00716  **/
00717 static uint32_t readSigBytes(void)
00718 {
00719     uint8_t command[4];
00720     uint32_t sigBytesOut = 0;
00721 
00722     command[0] = getHighByte(READ_SIG_BYTE);
00723     command[1] = getLowByte(READ_SIG_BYTE);
00724     command[3] = 0;
00725 
00726     command[2] = 0;
00727     spiInstruction(command);
00728     sigBytesOut |= ((uint32_t)command[3]) << 16;
00729 
00730     command[2] = 1;
00731     spiInstruction(command);
00732     sigBytesOut |= ((uint32_t)command[3]) << 8;
00733 
00734     command[2] = 2;
00735     spiInstruction(command);
00736     sigBytesOut |= (uint32_t)command[3];
00737 
00738     return sigBytesOut;
00739 }
00740 
00741 
00742 /**
00743  * Write to ATmega's flash memory.
00744  *
00745  * @param data what to write to flash.
00746  * @param address where to start writing
00747  * @param size how many bytes to write.
00748  **/
00749 static void writeFlash(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00750 {
00751     uint32_t end = address + size - 1;
00752     uint32_t pageEnd = address | (pageSize - 1);
00753 
00754     /* Check parameters are within limits of EEPROM */
00755     if ((address + size) > info.memorySize) {
00756         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Cannot write to address %u of %u byte memory\n",
00757                 end, info.memorySize);
00758         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00759     }
00760 
00761     /* Write to 1 page at a time */
00762     for (; address <= end; pageEnd += pageSize) {
00763         pageEnd = (pageEnd <= end) ? pageEnd : end;
00764         writeFlashPage(data, address, pageEnd);
00765         data += pageEnd - address + 1;
00766         address = pageEnd + 1;
00767     }
00768 }
00769 
00770 
00771 /**
00772  * Write to a single memory page in ATmega's memory.
00773  *
00774  * @param data the data to store in the page.
00775  * @param start where to start writing
00776  * @param end where to stop writing.
00777  **/
00778 static void writeFlashPage(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t start, uint32_t end)
00779 {
00780     uint8_t* loadPage;
00781     uint8_t* loadPagePtr;
00782     uint32_t i;
00783 
00784     if (NULL == (loadPage = (uint8_t*)malloc((pageSize * 4) + 4))) {
00785         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: could not allocate %u bytes at %s.\n",
00786                 (pageSize * 4) + 4, LOC);
00787         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00788     }
00789     memset(loadPage, 0xFF, (pageSize * 4) + 4);
00790     loadPagePtr = loadPage;
00791 
00792     /* Firstly, create all commands to fill page in local memory */
00793     for (i = start; i <= end; ++i) {
00794 
00795         /* Low byte must be loaded first */
00796         if ((i & 1) == 0) {
00797             *loadPagePtr++ = getHighByte(LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_LOW);
00798             *loadPagePtr++ = getLowByte(LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_LOW);
00799 
00800         }
00801         else {
00802             *loadPagePtr++ = getHighByte(LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_HIGH);
00803             *loadPagePtr++ = getLowByte(LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_HIGH);
00804         }
00805 
00806         /* Word address (increments every second loop) */
00807         *loadPagePtr++ = (i >> 1) & 0x007F;
00808 
00809         /* Data */
00810         *loadPagePtr++ = *data++;
00811     }
00812 
00813     /*
00814      * Bytes must be written in words. If the last byte is the low byte, then a
00815      * dummy byte must be added so that the last byte is written.
00816      */
00817     if ((i & 1) == 1) {
00818         *loadPagePtr++ = getHighByte(LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_HIGH);
00819         *loadPagePtr++ = getLowByte(LOAD_PROG_MEM_PAGE_HIGH);
00820         *loadPagePtr++ = (i >> 1) & 0x007F;
00821         *loadPagePtr++ = 0xFF;
00822     }
00823 
00824     /* Add command to write the program page to the flash */
00825     *loadPagePtr++ = getHighByte(WRITE_PROG_MEM_PAGE);
00826     *loadPagePtr++ = getHighByte((start >> 1) & ~0x007F);
00827     *loadPagePtr++ = getLowByte((start >> 1) & ~0x007F);
00828     *loadPagePtr++ = 0x00;
00829 
00830     /* Send commands to ATmega */
00831     ftSpi_readWrite(NULL, loadPage, (pageSize * 4) + 4, false);
00832 
00833     /* Wait for write to complete */
00834     sleep_ms(DELAY_FLASH);
00835 
00836     free(loadPage);
00837 }
00838 
00839 
00840 /**
00841  * Reads from the flash (program memory).
00842  *
00843  * @param[out] data where to store read data.
00844  * @param address where to start reading.
00845  * @param size how many bytes to read.
00846  **/
00847 static void readFlash(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00848 {
00849     uint8_t* outBytes;
00850     uint8_t* outBytePtr;
00851     uint8_t* inBytes;
00852     uint32_t i;
00853     
00854     outBytes = (uint8_t*)malloc(size * 4);
00855     inBytes = (uint8_t*)malloc(size * 4);
00856     if (outBytes == NULL || inBytes == NULL) {
00857         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: could not allocate %u bytes at %s.\n",
00858                 size * 4, LOC);
00859         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00860     }
00861     
00862     /* Create commands to read chosen memory area */
00863     outBytePtr = outBytes;
00864     for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
00865         if (((address + i) & 1) == 0) {
00866             *outBytePtr++ = getHighByte(READ_PROG_MEM_LOW);
00867         }
00868         else {
00869             *outBytePtr++ = getHighByte(READ_PROG_MEM_HIGH);
00870         }
00871         *outBytePtr++ = getHighByte((address + i) / 2);
00872         *outBytePtr++ = getLowByte((address + i) / 2);
00873         *outBytePtr++ = 0;
00874     }
00875 
00876     /* Send commands and receive memory data */
00877     ftSpi_readWrite(inBytes, outBytes, size * 4, false);
00878 
00879     /* Copy memory data to "data" */
00880     for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
00881         /* (((i+1) * 4) - 1) = 3, 7, 11, ... */
00882         data[i] = inBytes[((i+1) * 4) - 1];
00883     }
00884 
00885     free(outBytes);
00886     free(inBytes);
00887 }
00888 
00889 
00890 /**
00891  * Writes to the EEPROM (data memory).
00892  *
00893  * @param data the data to be written.
00894  * @param address where to start writing.
00895  * @param size how many bytes to write.
00896  **/
00897 static void writeEeprom(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00898 {
00899     uint8_t command[4];
00900     uint32_t i;
00901 
00902     command[0] = getHighByte(WRITE_EEPROM_MEM);
00903 
00904     for (i = address; i < size; ++i) {
00905         command[1] = getHighByte(i);
00906         command[2] = getLowByte(i);
00907         command[3] = data[i];
00908         spiInstruction(command);
00909 
00910         /* Wait for write to complete */
00911         sleep_ms(DELAY_EEPROM);
00912     }
00913 }
00914 
00915 
00916 /**
00917  * Writes 0xFF to every location in the EEPROM.
00918  **/
00919 static void eraseEeprom(void)
00920 {
00921     uint8_t data[info.memorySize];
00922     
00923     memset(data, 0xFF, info.memorySize);
00924     writeEeprom(data, 0, info.memorySize);
00925 }
00926 
00927 
00928 /**
00929  * Reads from the EEPROM (data memory).
00930  *
00931  * @param[out] data where to store read data.
00932  * @param address where to start reading.
00933  * @param size how many bytes to read.
00934  **/
00935 static void readEeprom(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size)
00936 {
00937     uint8_t* outBytes;
00938     uint8_t* outBytePtr;
00939     uint8_t* inBytes;
00940     uint32_t i;
00941 
00942     outBytes = (uint8_t*)malloc(size * 4);
00943     inBytes = (uint8_t*)malloc(size * 4);
00944     if (outBytes == NULL || inBytes == NULL) {
00945         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: could not allocate %u bytes at %s.\n",
00946                 size * 4, LOC);
00947         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00948     }
00949 
00950     /* Create commands to read chosen memory area */
00951     outBytePtr = outBytes;
00952     for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
00953         *outBytePtr++ = getHighByte(READ_EEPROM_MEM);
00954         *outBytePtr++ = getHighByte((address + i));
00955         *outBytePtr++ = getLowByte((address + i));
00956         *outBytePtr++ = 0;
00957     }
00958 
00959     /* Send commands and receive memory data */
00960     ftSpi_readWrite(inBytes, outBytes, size * 4, false);
00961 
00962     /* Copy memory data to "data" */
00963     for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
00964         /* (((i+1) * 4) - 1) = 3, 7, 11, ... */
00965         data[i] = inBytes[((i+1) * 4) - 1];
00966     }
00967     
00968     free(outBytes);
00969     free(inBytes);
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00973 /**
00974  * Writes the three fuse bytes
00975  *
00976  * @param fuses the three fuse bytes: @c "<ext><high><low>".
00977  **/
00978 static void writeFuses(const uint8_t fuses[3])
00979 {
00980     uint8_t command[4];
00981 
00982     command[0] = getHighByte(WRITE_FUSE_EXT_BITS);
00983     command[1] = getLowByte(WRITE_FUSE_EXT_BITS);
00984     command[3] = fuses[FUSE_EXT];
00985     spiInstruction(command);
00986     /* Wait for write to complete */
00987     sleep_ms(5);
00988 
00989     command[0] = getHighByte(WRITE_FUSE_HIGH_BITS);
00990     command[1] = getLowByte(WRITE_FUSE_HIGH_BITS);
00991     command[3] = fuses[FUSE_HIGH];
00992     spiInstruction(command);
00993     /* Wait for write to complete */
00994     sleep_ms(5);
00995 
00996     command[0] = getHighByte(WRITE_FUSE_BITS);
00997     command[1] = getLowByte(WRITE_FUSE_BITS);
00998     command[3] = fuses[FUSE_LOW];
00999     spiInstruction(command);
01000     /* Wait for write to complete */
01001     sleep_ms(DELAY_FLASH);
01002 }
01003 
01004 
01005 /**
01006  * Reads the three fuse bytes
01007  *
01008  * @param[out] fuses the three fuse bytes: @c "<ext><high><low>".
01009  **/
01010 static void readFuses(uint8_t fuses[3])
01011 {
01012     uint8_t command[4];
01013 
01014     command[0] = getHighByte(READ_FUSE_EXT_BITS);
01015     command[1] = getLowByte(READ_FUSE_EXT_BITS);
01016     spiInstruction(command);
01017     fuses[FUSE_EXT] = command[3];
01018 
01019     command[0] = getHighByte(READ_FUSE_HIGH_BITS);
01020     command[1] = getLowByte(READ_FUSE_HIGH_BITS);
01021     spiInstruction(command);
01022     fuses[FUSE_HIGH] = command[3];
01023 
01024     command[0] = getHighByte(READ_FUSE_BITS);
01025     command[1] = getLowByte(READ_FUSE_BITS);
01026     spiInstruction(command);
01027     fuses[FUSE_LOW] = command[3];
01028 }
01029 
01030 
01031 /**
01032  * Does a single SPI instruction.
01033  *
01034  * @param[in,out] bytes the 4 bytes to send to the ATmega. Data returned from
01035  *     the ATmega will be put into the last byte.
01036  **/
01037 static void spiInstruction(uint8_t bytes[4])
01038 {
01039     uint8_t readBytes[4];
01040 
01041     ftSpi_readWrite(readBytes, bytes, 4, false);
01042 
01043     /* Check if atmega is echoing bytes correctly */
01044     if ((readBytes[1] != bytes[0]) || (readBytes[2] != bytes[1])) {
01045         fprintf(stderr,
01046                 "ERROR: ATmega did not echo bytes correctly.\n");
01047         fprintf(stderr, " out:    %.2X %.2X %.2X %.2X\n",
01048                bytes[0], bytes[1], bytes[2], bytes[3]);
01049         fprintf(stderr, " in:  %.2X %.2X %.2X %.2X\n",
01050                readBytes[0], readBytes[1], readBytes[2], readBytes[3]);
01051         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01052     }
01053 
01054     /* Copy last byte which can be output from microcontroller */
01055     bytes[3] = readBytes[3];
01056 }
